content.text: I’ve been using stronger for 7 months now and it’s haven’t looked back. This is a phenomenal app that keeps me on schedule and helps me track my progress. There are the occasional bugs but that is with any app. I highly recommend this app for anyone struggling to keep a consistent routine.

title: Like the concept however there’s some issues

content.text: I like the concept however I spent a lot of time editing workouts for it be on the wrong day. And there’s no way to move a workout to another day for a mistake like that. If this could be fixed then it would be a perfect app to track what muscle groups you’re targeting.

Like the concept however there’s some issues

content.text:
I’ve been using this app for a few months now, and I love it to say the least. Love being able to add in workouts, and the idea of badges and streaks, and especially seeing where you have hit visually is really appealing.

The only issue is that it doesn’t seem to show on the app what we are hitting unless you do a certain set of volume.
I know I hit my forearms like crazy, but even with the isolation I do, I can never get it to show that I worked it on here. I haven’t had a issue with anything else, but in terms of majority of muscles you work, your forearms take in a big factor of activation; even without isolating them like I do.

Great, but one thing

content.text: Only lets you pick 6 days out of the week to train. It should let you pick how many days an actual schedule works for. I have a 4 day repeating workout split and that only fits into a week once. I don't take rest days and this stupid app is forcing me to schedule one!

title: Default settings odd paid features not worth

content.text:
I uninstalled this app. By default the app has units listed in kg, which is fine. But if you change your settings to lbs it updates all of your previously entered weights. Since I did not feel like re editing all of my previous workouts I just abandoned ship. 

Entering exercises is also clunky and takes more effort than it’s worth
content.html:
Default settings odd paid features not worth

content.text: App will be 5/5 if this is fixed - when a workout is logged on the 1st of the month, it doesn’t add it to the monthly total. Also, the graphs showing the weekly and monthly totals often are incorrect, and will glitch and only show the most recent 3-4 months, with incorrect numbers.
content.html:
Tracking issues

App will be 5/5 if this is fixed - when a workout is logged on the 1st of the month, it doesn’t add it to the monthly total. Also, the graphs showing the weekly and monthly totals often are incorrect, and will glitch and only show the most recent 3-4 months, with incorrect numbers.
content.cleanHtml: Tracking issues App will be 5/5 if this is fixed - when a workout is logged on the 1st of the month, it doesn’t add it to the monthly total. Also, the graphs showing the weekly and monthly totals often are incorrect, and will glitch and only show the most recent 3-4 months, with incorrect numbers.

content.text: Listen, this app is great. It’s really helpful as a reminder of what workouts and the weights to them I hit last, and the weekly streak and little panda themed cards at the end of every workout are very motivational. It’s cool to see what parts I hit well, and what I need to improve upon. Also, with such a wide list of workouts in the selection it’s easy to mark off what I did, and if the workout isn’t there, it has a free custom workout feature, which many other apps don’t include. The only problem I have with with the app is marking failures and warmups. It’s such a small feature to not have for free and it’s something that I feel should be free. I understand there need to be a few features blocked to premium, but the marking is so small, yet it would really round out the other free features included with the app.
content.html:
Great… but

content.text: I really enjoy the app but it’s not optimized for smaller screens like the iPhone SE 3 so some stuff kinda clips over and hides some words and images. I like that they recently added cardio workouts but the measurements are in meters and I haven’t found a way to change it like you can do with kilograms to pounds. I’d also like to see them add a cardio option under the add workout button and the option to add pictures for each workout you add so I can take a picture of a machine and add is there instead of it just showing the first letter of the workout. If they added smaller more targeted muscle groups to the app to more focus on body building then I would buy the premium but currently as is I don’t see a reason to pay for the extra features.

title: Really Good Idea - Please Fix Interface

content.text: Overall I think this app encompasses a great concept - connect with your friends & keep each other accountable for working out. My main issue with this app, is that I can’t even see my previous workouts. It’s extremely frustrating that my friends are able to see my workouts but I cannot. Secondly, there are limited exercises. I’d love to see updates to include more exercises that include cardio/mobility - this would make the app more inclusive and probably bring in more customers. Lastly, not all muscle groups are available to choose from when creating a custom exercise - delts, lats, obliques etc. It would be great to have the ability to customize my workouts further to show the actual muscle groups used, not just a general “abs”.
content.html:
Really Good Idea - Please Fix Interface

Lastly, not all muscle groups are available to choose from when creating a custom exercise - delts, lats, obliques etc. It would be great to have the ability to customize my workouts further to show the actual muscle groups used, not just a general “abs”.

content.text: Which weight should I use for dumbbell exercises, the combined weight or per dumbbell weight. Other then that amazing app that’s the only problem I have with it

content.text:
I understand that it is important to make money off the app, but some of the features are ridiculous. My friends and I thought it would be fun to log all our workouts to see how we compare with each other, but to even create a group requires a membership. After that i thought maybe i could just use it for myself, but the app is not very streamlined and is missing edit and delete functions for past workouts, If you accidentally put in the wrong weight or day for the workout then you’re screwed.

Overall i am very dissatisfied with the app and I will not be using it.

Lots of disappointing/missing features

content.text:
Best free fitness app I’ve found. Good for tracking workouts over time and seeing PR’s and such. Surprising as to which workouts are already in the app; there are some very common workouts not included, but you can easily add any. 

Fun tracking milestones by comparing weight lifted to real-life things. 

Wish I could create a group with friends without paying for Pro. Maybe 5 people in a group before you need to pay? Just wanna keep logs on friends. Almost think that would create more competition among us and use th app more…

No required paywalls to use the app effectively.

Best free fitness app

Wish I could create a group with friends without paying for Pro. Maybe 5 people in a group before you need to pay? Just wanna keep logs on friends. Almost think that would create more competition among us and use th app more…

content.text: Usually I don’t write reviews but I felt like I needed to for this one. This app is probably the best app I have ever used for working out. I really like that not everything is behind a paywall and we don’t need to do anything special to access features like we would on other apps. The streak feature has helped me quite a bit because I want to be better ever week. Overall just a really great app that I think everybody should have.

content.text:
This seems like a cool idea to compare your lifts to animals and all that but it would be cool and also easier to use if it was possible to integrate a different app like Strong or FitBod and translate the workout directly to your app.

If that didn’t make sense here’s an example 

Today is leg day
I track leg day in strong/fitbod
The workout is transferred into stronger and says “you lifted a 20 gorillas” or something like that.

Just though it would be cool.
content.html:
Suggestion To Devs

The workout is transferred into stronger and says “you lifted a 20 gorillas” or something like that.

Just though it would be cool.

content.text: I literally was thinking one day what it would be like to have an app that makes the gym more fun and on the same day i discovered this.It’s seriously such a cool app
content.html:
The best gym app ever

content.text: I’ve never seen an app like this where you can track your progress in this sense that it doesn’t feel like your “working”. The app is designed great and the layout is very well thought out. I was only able to log the exercise weight in kilos and it would be nice to have the option to switch it to pounds, but that isn’t nearly important enough to take away a well deserved 5 star review.
content.html:
Great and Unique app

content.text: Love the app, only complaint I have right now is after adding a set, the weight automatically changes to some random number. For example, I inputted a set with a weight of 15 lbs, and after hitting “add set” that weight changed to “6.18181818” so it’s kind of annoying having to delete that number everytime to add a new set
content.html:
Only Complaint

content.text: I really like the concept behind this but it doesn't seem to save all of my data. Sometimes it'll save my progress for the week but won't save my body weight or the unit it's in.
content.html:
Needs some minor adjustments

I really like the concept behind this but it doesn't seem to save all of my data. Sometimes it'll save my progress for the week but won't save my body weight or the unit it's in.

content.text: These guys know what they’re doing. They’re responsive on social media, constantly updating and sharing those updates. I love that the app has the specific workouts built in. It feels like such a hassle logging workouts on different apps. All that is not even to mention the best aspect which is the fun and motivation that comes with the logging system. Great app all around!

W DEVS
